output.conclusion: By completing this course, you will have a strong foundation in data statistics, enabling you to analyze data effectively and make informed decisions.
output.introduction: Welcome to Data Statistics! This course is designed for intermediate learners who want to deepen their understanding of statistical concepts and apply them to real-world data analysis.

chapters.description: Introduction to descriptive statistics: measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode) and dispersion (variance, standard deviation, range).
Exploring data visualization methods: histograms, box plots, scatter plots, and their interpretations.
Overview of common distributions: normal, binomial, Poisson, and their properties.
Different sampling techniques: simple random sampling, stratified sampling, cluster sampling.
Understanding the Central Limit Theorem and its importance in statistical inference.
Constructing and interpreting confidence intervals for population parameters.
Introduction to hypothesis testing: null and alternative hypotheses, p-values, significance level.
Performing t-tests for comparing means of one or two samples.
Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) for comparing means of multiple groups.
Measuring the strength and direction of linear relationships between variables.
Building and interpreting simple linear regression models.
Extending linear regression to multiple predictor variables.
Using chi-square tests for categorical data analysis: goodness-of-fit and independence tests.
Introduction to non-parametric tests: when to use them and examples like Mann-Whitney U test.
Understanding statistical power and its importance in hypothesis testing.
